name: Address
overview:
This class allows you interact with Google Compute Engine.

First, install @google-cloud/compute with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/compute

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/computeâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Compute Engine

var gce = require('@google-cloud/compute')();

Elsewhere

var gce = require('@google-cloud/compute')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/compute are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: Address
methods.description: An Address object allows you to interact with a Google Compute Engine address.

examples.code:
var region = gce.region('region-name');

var address = region.address('address1');

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: get
methods.description:
Get an address if it exists.

You may optionally use this to "get or create" an object by providing an object with autoCreate set to true. Any extra configuration that is normally required for the create method must be contained within this object as well.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options.autoCreate
params.description: • Automatically create the object if it does not exist. Default: false
